instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL is another way to say SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL, look at the definition provided for SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL as it applies to .
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT
threads.message:
hi, this came in, clean.
ppbus is 12.2v
pp3v42 is 3.3v
but theres no green light.
I have used my known good smc in the customer board, but still no green light.
then i saw <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> is 0.5v.
<RESISTOR>R5087</RESISTOR> is good, i have replaced it too.
<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> has been replaced.
diode mode of <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL</SIGNAL> and sda is same, at 0.484. voltage is same too.
i have make sure that continuity of <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> reach bottom of smc.
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> continuity is present on bottom of smc as well.

i read this post : [URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-from-no-power-to-power-then-no-power.21236/[/URL]
"Is <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> fluctuating between 16.6v to 16.1v rapidly on pin 1 or 2 of <DIODE>D7005</DIODE> " 
and my ppdcin is fluctuating as rossmann say, is this the cause ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT
threads.message:
Do you get correct 20MHz oscillation at Y5010?
If no o-scope available, post <SIGNAL>SMC_XTAL</SIGNAL>/EXTAL DC voltage.

Should be good to try another <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT
threads.message:
unfortunately i dont have o scope.
<SIGNAL>SMC_EXTAL</SIGNAL> is 1.6v ( diode mode 0.737 )
<SIGNAL>SMC_XTAL</SIGNAL> is 0v ( diode mode 0.722 )

another <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> is tried, but still same symptom..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT
threads.message:
just curious, but if i jump <RESISTOR>R5087</RESISTOR>, i have green light, board turn on and post.
but better take care of this the proper way.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO GREEN LIGHT
threads.message: Replace <RESISTOR>R5087</RESISTOR>; you can use 100-330K, instead of 470K.
